snippet: The superfluous bone, seen in fossil samples, was a sign of inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy.
abstract: Study in journal PeerJ reports that many woolly mammoths from North Sea had superfluous rib attached to seventh vertebra, sign that they suffered from inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy; anomaly may have contributed to their extinction 12,000 to 10,000 years ago.
lead_paragraph: The superfluous bone, seen in fossil samples, was a sign of inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy.

headline.main: In Extra Rib, a Harbinger of Mammoth’s Doom
headline.print_headline: Fossils: In Extra Rib, a Harbinger of Mammoth’s Doom
